title: Newtons 3rd law - accelerating in an elevator

content.description: A person stands on a scale in an elevator. Consider the following four forces:
content.question: <math alttext="F sub person on scale, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></msub></math> : The force of the person on the scale <math alttext="F sub scale on person, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow></msub></math> : The force of the scale on the person <math alttext="F sub person on Earth, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow></msub></math> : The force of the person on Earth <math alttext="F sub Earth on person, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow></msub></math> : The force of Earth on the person Which of the following correctly ranks the magnitudes of these forces while the elevator is moving upward with increasing speed?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, F sub person on scale, end sub, equals F sub scale on person, end sub, close parenthesis, is greater than F sub Earth on person, end sub, which is greater than F sub person on Earth, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="F sub scale on person, end sub, equals F sub person on Earth, end sub, which is greater than F sub person on scale, end sub, which is greater than F sub Earth on person, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mpadded><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow></msub></mpadded></mpadded><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, F sub person on scale, end sub, equals F sub scale on person, end sub, close parenthesis, is greater than open parenthesis, F sub person on Earth, end sub, which is equal to F sub Earth on person, end sub, end parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>></mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
